Eating Snow Is Good For You

Scientists at our University have looked at the age old myth... Can eating snow save your life? Should you do it at all?

While this question isn't exactly straightforward, we can confidently say that eating snow is perfectly harmless, and that it aids in the lowering of body temperatures. This can actually be benificial in many situations; skiing for example. When heavy ski coats are unnecessarily causing our internal body temperature to rise, our bodies are working much harder to cool down (usually in sweat) than they should be. Eating snow can be benificial because it dissipates the heat naturally, allowing our bodies to focus on absorbing the next jump or mogul and not on cooling the insides!
